comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: I thought this looked vaguely familiar - Julian Ashton "Old houses, Cumberland Street" (AGNSW) - collection.artgallery.nsw.gov.au/collection/results.do?id...

comment.realname: lifeasdaddy ...a guy, his wife, and their son...
comment.author: 13267298@N00
comment._content:
Good find.  Do you know what date the Ashton painting was done? 

 It appears to be after the phtograph, as the major house in the photograph is in ruins or demolished in the painting and the tree near the bend in the road at left is much larger in the painting.

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: I think the photo was part of the series taken in 1901 after the bubonic plague. So presumably the Ashton painting is soon after demolition. It seems the unnamed photographer and Ashton might have known each other, just as with this photo - www.flickr.com/photos/powerhouse_museum/2844602875/ . I am keeping an eye out for other matches.

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: There are chooks wandering around in the Ashton painting too.

comment.author: 32162360@N00
25550875@N02
comment._content: Hi, I'm an admin for a group called Sembra incredibile ma....eravamo così!!!, and we'd love to have this added to the group!

comment.author: 27331537@N06
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/beachcomberaustralia] Good find there! We have dated this photo 1900. Thanks.

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: H. Stuart Wilson - "95 and 97 Cumberland Street, The Rocks" 1902 (State Library NSW, ML 1436) acms.sl.nsw.gov.au/item/itemLarge.aspx?itemID=863037

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: And another by Gother Victor Fyers Mann (1900) - acms.sl.nsw.gov.au/album/ItemViewer.aspx?itemid=874513&am... It is no.3 in an album - acms.sl.nsw.gov.au/album/albumView.aspx?acmsID=845772&amp... [with thanks to pellethepoet and the Historic Houses Trust Exhibition - www.hht.net.au/whats_on/exhibitions/exhibitions/painting_... ]

comment._content: Another equivalent artwork found - Cumberland Street (no date) by Sir William Johnson

comment.author: 47201412@N02
comment._content: The backyard of 95 Cumberland Street by our hero John Degotardi, Jr. (How did we miss it?) 294 No. 95 Cumberland-street (rear) [SLNSW: a147294] from Views taken during Cleansing Operations, Quarantine Area, Sydney, 1900, Vol. V / under the supervision of Mr George McCredie, F.I.A., N.S.W. [photographed by John Degotardi Jr.] - page 4, thumbnail 32

comment.author: 27331537@N06
comment._content: This photo was recently determined to be part of the Rocks Resumption photographic survey, the title and date of the image has been changed accordingly Here is a map of the Rocks Resumption area (last one in the sequence) AB
